thread.title: What feminism? Vanity Fair uses comedy sketch as basis for degrading Kellyanne Conway
thread.title_full: What feminism? Vanity Fair uses comedy sketch as basis for degrading Kellyanne Conway

author: Jacob B.
title: What feminism? Vanity Fair uses comedy sketch as basis for degrading Kellyanne Conway
text:
What feminism? Vanity Fair uses comedy sketch as basis for degrading Kellyanne Conway Posted at 5:15 pm on January 22, 2017 by Jacob B. 
According to Vanity Fair, if you are an influential woman on the right, you must be “grasping” or an “attention-hungry player.” #SNL exposes Kellyanne Conway for the grasping, attention-hungry player she is https://t.co/5w02JpDDzo pic.twitter.com/LXXhe3PqXL 
— VANITY FAIR (@VanityFair) January 22, 2017 
The article tried to hide behind last night’s Saturday Night Live skit as the basis for its degrading claims. It didn’t work. NEWSFLASH: Sketch Comedy is not identical to documentary films, and should not be assumed to be based in truth. https://t.co/4o3T1cWo57 
It’s comedy when the Left is the subject. When a conservative is being portrayed, Saturday Night Live suddenly becomes a primary historical reference documentary. We totes support women UNLESS they are conservative women, then Nah.. https://t.co/4BOiTQjfQJ
